source.title: Concurrent activation of striatal direct and indirect pathways during action initiation

confidence_rationale: Direct basal-ganglia action-initiation evidence supports action-mode gating as active release dynamics, not passive single-lane routing.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Direct and indirect striatal pathways are concurrently engaged during action initiation rather than purely sequential winner-take-all activation.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports MECH-025 action mode as an actively coordinated gating regime that can still preserve commitment and release.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Mouse pathway dynamics do not directly encode human-scale cognitive mode semantics or full REE ethical commitments.
mapping.source_context: In vivo pathway activity during movement initiation in striatal circuits.

confidence_components.notes: Strong pathway evidence for nuanced gating during action release.
